about.summary: Functions to justify alpha levels for statistical hypothesis tests by avoiding Lindley's paradox, or by minimizing or balancing error rates. For more information about the package please read the following: Maier & Lakens (2021) <doi:10.31234/osf.io/ts4r6>).

Functions to justify alpha levels for statistical hypothesis tests by avoiding Lindley's paradox, or by minimizing or balancing error rates. For more information about the package please read the following: Maier & Lakens (2021) <doi:10.31234/osf.io/ts4r6>).

name: r-justifyalpha
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.1' %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-justifyalpha
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/JustifyAlpha_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/JustifyAlpha/JustifyAlpha_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c929630414aa79e1adf9a32b57f254b086a91d3a3874810b55b324ab89d5a72d

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip  # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bayesfactor
    - r-superpower
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-pwr
    - r-qpdf
    - r-shiny
    - r-shinydashboard
    - r-stringr

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-bayesfactor
    - r-superpower
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-pwr
    - r-qpdf
    - r-shiny
    - r-shinydashboard
    - r-stringr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('JustifyAlpha')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('JustifyAlpha')\""  # [win]


about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=JustifyAlpha
  license: MIT
  summary: 'Functions to justify alpha levels for statistical hypothesis tests by avoiding Lindley''s
    paradox, or by minimizing or balancing error rates. For more information about the
    package please read the following: Maier & Lakens (2021) <doi:10.31234/osf.io/ts4r6>).'
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

# The original CRAN metadata for this package was:

# Package: JustifyAlpha
# Title: Justifying Alpha Levels for Hypothesis Tests
# Version: 0.1.1
# Authors@R: c(person(given = "Maximilian", family = "Maier", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "maximilianmaier0401@gmail.com"), person(given = "Daniel", family = "Lakens", role = c("aut"), email = "D.Lakens@tue.nl", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-0247-239X")) )
# Description: Functions to justify alpha levels for statistical hypothesis tests by avoiding Lindley's paradox, or by minimizing or balancing error rates. For more information about the package please read the following: Maier & Lakens (2021) <doi:10.31234/osf.io/ts4r6>).
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# Imports: stats, BayesFactor, ggplot2, stringr, shiny, Superpower, pwr, shinydashboard, qpdf
# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown, testthat,
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2021-09-13 19:34:27 UTC; Maximilian Maier
# Author: Maximilian Maier [aut, cre], Daniel Lakens [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0247-239X>)
# Maintainer: Maximilian Maier <maximilianmaier0401@gmail.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2021-09-15 08:00:08 UTC

# See
# https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build for
# more information about meta.yaml
